intro: Quaqua armata subsp. pilifera, commonly known as the silky quava, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
